prompt: Identify an animal that can shoot water from its snout.
icl_complete: The archerfish is an animal known for its unique ability to shoot jets of water from its mouth (rather than its snout) to knock insects and other prey off of overhanging vegetation into the water, where it can then consume them. Archerfish are remarkable for their precision and accuracy, capable of hitting targets with impressive aim.
